action.label: context

action.content:
Q: Is the following sentence plausible? "George Springer committed a blocking foul."
A: no, in basketball, a "blocking foul" is not typically associated with a fielding position like center fielder, and the term "blocking" is more commonly used in ice hockey or lacrosse contexts; in basketball, a "blocking" action is more likely to involve a defensive play, not a foul.
Q: Is the following sentence plausible? "Nikola Jokić made a three-pointer in the fourth quarter of the game."
A: yes
Q: Is the following sentence plausible? "Luka Dončić dished an assist in the second half of the game."
A: yes
Q: Is the following sentence plausible? "Giannis Antetokounmpo made a free throw in the third period of the game."
A: yes
Q: Is the following sentence plausible? "Stephen Curry made a three-pointer in the first half of the game."
A: yes
Q: Is the following sentence plausible? "Kevin Durant made a three-pointer in the fourth period of the game."
A: yes
Q: Is the following sentence plausible? "Joel Embiid made a three-pointer in the second half of the game."
A: no, while Joel Embiid is a skilled big man, he is not typically known for his outside shooting; in the NBA, power forwards and centers are not typically associated with making three-pointers.
